intro: Saxifraga vanbruntiae, commonly known as Vanbrunt’s saxifrage, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a perennial species that typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, thriving in well-drained soils. The plant produces clusters of small, pink or white flowers during the summer months. Its leaves are usually basal, forming a rosette shape, and are covered in fine, soft hairs. Saxifraga vanbruntiae is well adapted to harsh climates and is often found in high elevation areas.
